headline: Sweet Rice
description: Sweet rice, known as arroz con leche, is a lovely custard-like Mexican rice pudding with raisins, lightly flavored with cream, vanilla, and cinnamon.
name: Sweet Rice

recipeInstructions.text: Bring water, rice, and butter to a boil in a large saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes.

Whisk together 2 cups milk, sugar, egg, flour, and vanilla in a bowl; pour over cooked rice in the saucepan and stir to combine. Bring to a simmer over low heat and cook, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes.
Stir in remaining 1 cup milk, cream, raisins, and cinnamon until thoroughly mixed. Let cool for a few minutes. Serve warm or cold.

review.reviewBody: It turned out pretty well and made quite a large amount. I did not have any heavy cream on hand at the time and I added some condensed milk to the recipe, but it still turned out nicely. I also simmered a bit longer to thicken the consistency.
I did not use flour or heavy cream or raisins and I used park water and part milk in the cooking process in the beginning.
Great

This recipe is great! I did make 1 change and by doing so, my pudding was thick and delicious. Instead of using long-grain white rice, I used Sweet rice (often used to make sticky rice). Looks like long-grain white rice and when cooked tastes like it too...just in a thicker consistency. Perfect for this recipe if you want a thicker overall consistency.
I used leftover rice from dinner. I subbed sweetened condensed milk for 1 cup of milk and the sugar. It came out perfect!
I used sweetened condensed milk in stead of using sugar and flour and (2) eggs. Came out delicious, my family loved it!!

This recipe is the closest thing to my grandmas arroz con leche that’s I’ve found! The only thing I changed is I added a cinnamon stick in as well! That made it taste just like my grandmas! Just a side note to everyone talking about the consistency, this is a Spanish version of rice pudding, it is not meant to be thick. It’s meant to be soupy. The consistency is exactly what it’s supposed to be!

I also followed majority of these ingredients. I used La Lechera for one of the cups of whole milk, an made my "heavy cream" from scratch.. It was my first time ever making arroz con leche.. An everyone loved it.. So Thank you!

Needed additional sugar but otherwise it came out very good.

Sweet Rice and Raisins. I added additional real vanilla extract and additional raisins (my husband likes it this way). Doing this gave pudding a bit darker color. I also add the raisins earlier into the simmering rice to plump raisins up a bit (if you do this add a bit more water when boiling rice to account for raisins to swell). Like this reciepe a great deal, easy to make. Use whole milk and cream to make it very rich and pudding like.
I had to add an additional 1/3 c sugar. Turned out great!!
Easy to make and taste wonderful,will definitely be making this again.
Perfect recipe creamy rich!
Next time I would cut down on sugar. But very please with this recipe. I made it for Potluck and they were scrapping the bowl.

This was a great recipe. Like so many others before me, I also used the sweetened condensed milk and omitted the sugar and heavy cream. The second time I made this, I made a little change to the raisins to give it a little more flavor. I boiled a half of a cup of brandy and added the raisins to reconstitute them. Removed them from the brandy then mixed them into the pudding.

My family loves this recipe. I've tweaked it over all the times I've made it based on the available milks and creams in my fridge. I made it again the past weekend with leftover par boiled rice (I know I know, not the right rice but it still works) and it came out great. I usually add some cardamom and nutmeg because they add amazing flavour. Additionally I simmer it until it's slightly thick and then allow it to cool in a container with plastic wrap right on the surface to avoid the film. I use dried currants that plump up nicely in the pudding.
I want to make it soon, I'll add cinnamon

Delicious way to use up rice leftovers! I only used 1 tsp butter, maybe a total of 1 cup whole milk, 1/4 cup sugar. Turned out thick and creamy, just sweet enough. Yum- will make again the next time I have rice sitting in my fridge.

This is so good! creamy and delicious!!! This one is a keeper!
I love this recipe, I add a little anise extract ..gives it a extra kick :-) mmm
i really liked it! I added some coconut milk and evaporated milk. My family really enjoyed it!

I have made this recipe a couple of times now. Like others when I followed it exactly it was a little too runny and not sweet enough. Each time I "doctored" it up a bit and I've finally got it the way my gramma used to make it. I had a happy accident and added two eggs instead of one. Two make my two cups of Milk I added a whole can of sweetened condensed and topped it off with 2%. I left that third cup of milk out completely. No added sugar. Thosone were my only changes. It came out thicker and richer.

Don't know what I'm doing wrong, 1st time it was waaaay to runny, 2nd time it was not runny at all and tasted sticky. I used to eat sweet rice when I was younger and LOVED it.....guess I'll keep looking until I find a recipe similar to what I remember:(

This is a great recipe! Very creamy! I didn't change a thing and it thickened up just right. My husband said it wasn't sweet enough and added more sugar but I love it as is. As for those who say they loved this recipe but changed ingredients, you do realize don't you, that if you change an ingredient, add an ingredient or delete an ingredient then it is no longer this recipe. Just one of my petpeeves about many of the reviews on this site. But, enjoy this recipe as is or with alterations. bg

I've noticed a lot of reviews stating the rice is really soup-y or watery. I've made this plenty of times and it's always pretty thick. So, I'm thinking it could be that some people are following package directions for cooking the rice and then adding the water to the cooked rice? If that is not the problem, omit the 1 cup of milk added after the sweet rice is made, which will make it more custard-like. I hope this helps!
